column1: 5.1.5 Guidelines for screening and individual early detection

In asymptomatic men with a prostate-specific antigen (PSA) level between  
3–10 ng/mL and a normal digital rectal examination (DRE), repeat the PSA test  
prior to further investigations.

In asymptomatic men with a PSA level between 3–10 ng/mL and a normal DRE, use 
one of the following tools for biopsy indication: 
• 
risk-calculator, provided it is correctly calibrated to the population prevalence;
•  magnetic resonance imaging of the prostate

• 
an additional serum, urine biomarker test
